pull.title: [qa] Test walletpassphrase timeout
pull.body:
Test case for #7316

Test code: `$ git checkout fadceb7;make;BITCOIND=bitcoin-qt qa/pull-tester/rpc-tests.py keypool`

```
...
Running testscript keypool.py ...
Initializing test directory /tmp/testqf3QO4
Assertion failed: 1452255264 != 0
```

events.body:
Nice!
utACK.

But this actually does not test the issue #7316, because the reported issue can only happen when you run bitcoin-qt with `-server=1`.

@jonasschnelli See my "test code" ;)

Are you still working on the `BITCOIND=bitcoin-qt` nightly rpc tests?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -70,9 +70,11 @@ def run_test(self):
             assert(e.error['code']==-12)
 
         # refill keypool with three new addresses
-        nodes[0].walletpassphrase('test', 12000)
+        nodes[0].walletpassphrase('test', 1)
         nodes[0].keypoolrefill(3)
-        nodes[0].walletlock()
+        # test walletpassphrase timeout
+        time.sleep(1)
comments.body: Concept ACK, but setting a timeout of 1 and then waiting a second is too close. A slight mistiming (e.g. busy machine) would result in a race condition, what about waiting 2 seconds instead?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -70,9 +70,11 @@ def run_test(self):
             assert(e.error['code']==-12)
 
         # refill keypool with three new addresses
-        nodes[0].walletpassphrase('test', 12000)
+        nodes[0].walletpassphrase('test', 1)
         nodes[0].keypoolrefill(3)
-        nodes[0].walletlock()
+        # test walletpassphrase timeout
+        time.sleep(1.1)
+        assert_equal(nodes[0].getwalletinfo()["unlocked_until"], 0)
comments.body: Maybe this ought to actually try to do something to test the wallet relocking?
